intro: Miconia magdalenensis, commonly known as the Magdalena miconia, is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is native to the Caribbean region. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, attracting various pollinators. Its fruits are small, berry-like structures that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some tropical gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
